section.heading: Right of heir, devisee, or nonprobate transferee.

para.text: An heir, devisee, or nonprobate transferee of a deceased community-property spouse may assert a claim for relief with respect to a right under this chapter in accordance with the following rules:
In an action asserting a right in or to property, the heir, devisee, or nonprobate transferee must:
Not later than 3 years after the death of the decedent, commence an action against the surviving community-property spouse of the decedent who is in possession of the property; or
Not later than 6 months after appointment of the personal representative of the decedent, send a demand in a record to the personal representative; and
In an action other than an action under paragraph (1) of this subsection, the heir, devisee, or nonprobate transferee must:
Not later than 6 months after the appointment of the personal representative of the decedent, send a demand in a record to the personal representative; or
If a personal representative is not appointed, commence the action not later than 3 years after the death of the decedent.
